qas.question: Since when have Portuguese wines garnished international recognition?

answers.text: since the times of the Romans

qas.question: With which Roman God was Portugal associated with?
What are some of the best Portuguese wines?

answers.text: Vinho Verde, Vinho Alvarinho, Vinho do Douro, Vinho do Alentejo, Vinho do Dão, Vinho da Bairrada and the sweet: Port Wine, Madeira Wine

qas.question: Which two Portuguese wines are especially enjoyed around the world?

context: Portuguese wines have enjoyed international recognition <a0_0>since the times of the Romans<a0_0/>, who associated Portugal with their god <a1_0>Bacchus<a1_0/>. Today, the country is known by wine lovers and its wines have won several international prizes. Some of the best Portuguese wines are: <a2_0>Vinho Verde, Vinho Alvarinho, Vinho do Douro, Vinho do Alentejo, Vinho do Dão, Vinho da Bairrada and the sweet: Port Wine, Madeira Wine<a2_0/>, the Moscatel from Setúbal and Favaios. <a3_0>Port and Madeira<a3_0/> are particularly appreciated in a wide range of places around the world.
